There's so much going on in this book. In addition to my original review below, I'll add what made me fall in love with Devlin and Grace all over again.#1 He's a charmer with a vulnerable, loving heart. AND he's a god in bed. What else can a girl ask for?I keep trying to find a picture that does Devlin justice, but can't seem to get him right. This one looks too old and doesn't have his eyes. But you get the picture :P#2 Grace is brilliantly funny. Without trying to be. She reminds me of some of my very high IQ engineering friends in college (except they were all male).#3 The HOTT LOVE SCENES!!!! AJ is the queen of the intense love connection :)#4 The truly romantic finale.Grace, honey, you really outdone yourself. Devlin didn't have a chance against all that wooing!#5 The amazing world-building and character evolution that I've come to expect from AJMaking me beg for more!!!Below my original review.I always love everything Ms. James writes. The Pure Dark series just keeps getting better and better!I love that we meet Sophia again in the prologue and epilogue. I've been missing her from Book 1, Pure Healing. We get doses of Innana and Gabriel from Book 2, a mysterious person from Book 3, the Creature and Ere (who I have my suspicions about),members of the Chosen and Queen Jade, and Tal and Mama-Bear. Sort of the good rake from regency romances that I also like to read, except he's never really been a rake, even though all his comrades think he is one.And the cliff hanger at the end! I very much enjoy that Aja goes against the grain when it comes to her heroes. I enjoy the world that she tends to bring to life with her written word. This was no different, The second book may have been my favorite one in the series thus far, but I am not bored reading anything she writes. I find it fulfilling and of course, I do very much love my happy endings. I know in the end she is working on a big series climax and I can not wait to see what that is. Great Job Aja I am looking forward to seeing what you come up with next.

Wow another fab 5 star read... I loved Grace she was so robotic and funny, she has no shame whatsoever its great!!! I was kindly given an ARC of this book in exchange for an honest review!Dark Pleasures tells Devlin Sinclair’s story. Devlin is the sexy, somewhat smart-alecky Dark One we’ve gotten glimpses of in the past 2 books. Half the fun of the Pure/Dark Ones series is that (unless you ruin it by reading the blurb) you don’t know whose story is going to be coming up next. The other half of the fun is reading the books, which continue to pique my interest and keep me ravenous for more information.The female star of this book is Grace Darling, who’s an unlikely heroine as someone with a diagnosis on the autism spectrum. She lives alone and abides by a strict schedule, with only her aunt to check in on her. She likes it that way, too, until she meets Devlin. Grace’s interaction with Devlin confuses her, because emotions aren’t second nature to Grace. She’s a hacker, and her mind works in scientific and mathematical ways. I won’t ruin it here but the way that Grace and Devlin first begin their “relationship” is hilarious. If only it could be so cut and dry for all of us as it is for Grace!The story differs here from previous books because Ms. Aja James usually makes us wait for the male/female main characters to end up in bed together – this book starts out with a bang (badum-dum!) but that’s certainly not the end of it. And in addition to Grace & Devlin’s storyline we get a peek at some of our other favorite characters. In true Aja fashion we only get to see a little of this here, and little of that there-just enough to whet our appetite for more. It’s hard to say too much without giving spoilers, but know that some of your favorite side characters from recent books pop up just enough to drop a few more revelations. You think you have some things figured out but then a two minute conversation between certain characters can turn that completely upside down! This has to truly be one of the most well thought-out and planned series as I’m just amazed how everything ties in together, even things that previously seemed disconnected or standalone. And the characters that Aja James creates are either loveable or you love-to-hate-them, there’s not too much in between. As usual, the ending leaves me only wanting more!!

I received an ARC from the author!This series just keeps getting better and better. I love Devlin and Grace as a couple, but to be honest I was a bit more obsessed with Grace than Devlin. I loved that she was a genius/socially inept a la Sherlock (BBC), and that the author didn't stick to gender norms in that regard. And I especially loved that she knew what she wanted sexually and wasn't afraid to go for it! I was also super excited to see more of Sophia and I can't wait to read her novella. I definitely can't wait for the next in the series either!

4.5 "I'm Not Normal" StarsSo ya'll know I love this series. Like Love, Love! Like I'm obsessed with this series...The characters are well written, the story is extremely thought thru & fleshed out, & the plot flows well from book to book. Ya'll, I cannot brag on this author enough.I really liked the Hero Devlin. I loved his back story. I understood him & felt his vulnerability. The side stories were a treat. There was a couple of of Twist that were a nice treat. Lots & lots of Great For Me... My ONLY issue was I didn't feel connected to the Heroine. She has Autism Spectrum Disorder. I can emphasize with her, but I have a hard time connecting to her. I did feel her struggle with her disorder & how it impacted not only her but everyone around her. Where as she didn't "feel emotions" or or connected to people I have the opposite problem. I feel TOO MUCH & connect deeply to people. But that is TOTALLY MY ISSUE. Grace was still a great character & I feel like the author did her justice regarding her disorder.I really liked how these characters balanced each other very well. Each was what the other needed. She needed to feel & he needed to be felt. That was beautiful! The ending for them was perfect!I graciously received an ARC of this book for free from Author in exchange for an honest review. This does not affect my opinion of the book or the content of my review.

I was happy to see Sophia back for another installment of the series, so we get to see more of what is going on with her and a few loose ends left in book one are tied up. But at the same time, there's even more made. This series just keeps getting better and drawing me into it's characters and storylines more and more. This book ended way before I was ready for it to as I wanted to keep reading and learn more, but I'll definitely be back for future books!

Firstly you really do need to read the first three i this series to get the best out of this book . Loved the introduction by Sophia , the Pure Ones Queen , full of detail & few smiles . This book brings starts to weave all the characters we've met in previous books into one large, amazing story . We have a romance , we have a breaking of ties but not sure what that breaking means yet & we have true love rejected & looks like its going to end in tragedy , reading between the lines im guessing theres a huge misundertsanding somewhere . Devlin Sinclair who is known as the Dark Ones Hunter. His job is to hack into Zenn and therefore track down Medusa who’s been trying to destroy the Pure/Dark Ones. Although his hacking skills are among the best, it’s still not enough, he’s going to need help from Grace Darling who’s not only the very best hacker but she also apparently working for Zenn the enemy. Chatting online and gaining her trust while pretending to be someone else, Devlin meets Grace for a blind date. Devlin sits down and turns on his charm but Grace just stares at him and says nothing. Unbeknownst to him before the date she’s already checked out everything about the man he’s pretending to be. Grace hacked into a satellite and knows he should be bald and very plain, not a gorgeous blonde hunk that looks and smells wonderful and sounds even better! Grace tells him she’s going home and heads out. Devlin’s not used to this reaction from any woman and try’s to change her mind as he sees her home, not knowing she already decided to have him for a two week sex toy! This is a steaming sexy hot explosive story about two very different people who find in each other what they are both missing. I think anyone would absolutely love this book! Aja James Pure/ Dark Ones world that she’s created in this series is amazing and such fun to read! I can hardly wait to find out what’s coming next with all the characters like Tal, and Moma Bear, Sophie, the creature, oh and Ramses the new one Max just recruited! It’s just keeps getting better and better!

I absolutely loved reading about Grace. The book overall was great! At the end of this book, there are lots of unanswered questions that leave me feeling anxious to read the next installment of this series. I can't wait to see how the story evolves for Sophia, Tal, and Inanna, and to get the bigger picture of who is orchestrating the war.

Dark Pleasure is the perfect continuation of this series written by Aja James. The author continues come up with unique and intricate plots to keep each book in the series different and captivating, yet has a continuous story that links them all together. As expected there were some serious twists hidden in this one and also some nice revelations that the readers deserved! But there are still a lot of big ones we have yet to discover, so I can only imagine what the author will come up with next! The plot is very well developed and has the perfect pace to it. There is always a lot happening, making this a very difficult book to put down, but I expect no less at this point from this series. As usual there are quite a few hot steamy scenes in this one as well.I find it interesting that in this one again, the author picked a character that is not usually chosen as a main character in a paranormal book. In her last one it was basically a genius level female scientist, which is rather rare in a paranormal book, but in this one she took it a step further and picked an autistic female lead, along the lines of Asperger's I would say. I found that very interesting and refreshing and somehow the author made it work. You can't help but adore Grace and her transformation that you see her going through in this book. Yes I know in real life that would never happen that quickly but it was still very interesting to read.And oh Devlin, that poor man. You can't help but feel for him when you find out about his past and then you just know he had no chance against Grace. She was an all consuming avalanche and that was pretty much it! Those two together are just too much and again the author found a way to make them work.I admit, I may be biased but I love this series. The steamy scenes sometimes can be maybe a bit much, but that is part of what this series is based on. The author spends a lot of time on character development and focuses each book on a specific pair usually but also provides more insight on some other characters you have already met or will meet in the near future! Her action parts pack a punch and her plots are very well developed. In my eyes that is great. She brings a new twist to your usual vampire story by introducing Dark Ones vs Pure Ones and your standard Vampire. So any author that can bring a new twist to your vampire story to me already is way ahead of the game, and no she did not make them sparkle!

description: Devlin Sinclair, the New England Dark Ones’ Hunter, is on a mission to track down the elusive and mysterious Medusa, perhaps the ultimate nemesis the Pure and Dark Ones have been battling in recent years. But he can’t do it alone. Grace Darling has isolated herself from the world since a very young age, after her parents’ death and because of her own social disability. Awkward and brilliant, a born sensualist, Grace agrees to a blind date that changes the course of Destiny. She has the skills he needs. Their chemistry is off the charts, but will she, can she, give him the love he craves?
